alert.note: Alert for Box Elder; Cache; Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 10 at 2:55PM MST until January 10 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Weber County in northern Utah... Southwestern Cache County in northern Utah... East central Box Elder County in northern Utah... * Until 330 PM MST. * At 254 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles southeast of Hyrum to 15 miles west of Willard, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 15 between mile markers 347 and 377. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Logan, Brigham City, North Ogden, Hyrum, Perry, Wellsville, Willard, Marriott-Slaterville, Bear River City, Mantua, Corinne, Benson, South Willard, Peter, Pleasant View, Providence, Farr West, Harrisville, and Plain City. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
